intro: Marlierea rubiginosa, commonly known as the red-staining marlierea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a rough texture. Marlierea rubiginosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and streambanks.
